abstract: Prudential Financial may sell its investment and fund management businesses in South Korea, a deal which could fetch about $850 million and could trigger a wave of consolidation in the country’s brokerage and asset management sectors, where more than 100 companies compete.

lead_paragraph: Prudential Financial may sell its investment and fund management businesses in South Korea, a deal potentially worth $850 million that could trigger a wave of consolidation in the country’s brokerage and asset management sectors, where more than 100 companies compete.

headline.main: Prudential Mulls Sale of South Korean Units
